result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jonathon D Marcin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon D Marcin

defendant.name: Marcin, Jonathon D
defendant.address: 2104 High Ridge Trail Apt 205, Fitchburg, WI 53713

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from VIP Program Director, Mike Champion, dated 08/05/16 recommending that the defendant be sucessfully discharged from the VIP program effective immediatley as he has completed all of his conditions

Defendant Jonathon D Marcin in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:53 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Cousins makes statements regarding the defendant being allowed to participate in the VIP Program.
Court questions how the defendant will meet with his community mentor; Atty Cousins makes additional statements.
Mike Champion is questioned by the Court; Mr Champion makes his statements regarding the recommendation to have defendant put in the VIP Program.
Court questions Atty Govin and Atty Govin makes his statements regarding the VIP Program.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - Guilty
Count 4 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 3 & 4.  Clerk directed to NOT enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Govin makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 - 
VIP Program - 9 months
If successful completion of the VIP Program:  amended to ordinance with fine of $263.50
25 hours Community Service preferably to be completed in Portage County with the Portage County Parks Departmetn and if not then in Dane County (Madison)
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in other community based services as determined appropriate by the VIP Program Director. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Can be subject to random Urinalysis and Breath Tests.
Must sign release form for all treatment providers.  Sign all releases of information for all doctors and other treatment providers and pharmacy.

Count 4 - 
VIP Program - 9 months 
If successful completion of the VIP Program:  dismissed
To comply with conditions as stated in Count 1

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Jonathon D Marcin in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jonathon D Marcin in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he was denied by the public defender.  Has the paperwork. 
Court advises defendant to file the paperwork with the judicial assistant.  

State recommends a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Court will continue to allow the Court time to review the petition for appointment of counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
